flawed_nl_solution:
Ten years from now, the elder child will be 20+10 = <<10+20=30>>30 years old.
If the elder child is 20 years old now, the second born is 20-5 = <<20-5=51>>51 years old, 5 years younger than the firstborn.
The second-born will be 51+10 = 61 years old ten years from now.
The total age of the first and second-born 10 years from now will be 61+30 = <<61+30=91>>91
The third-born who is five years younger than the second born is 51-5 = <<51-5=46>>46 years old.
The third sibling's age ten years from now will be 46+10 = <<46+10=56>>56 years old.
The total age of the three siblings ten years from now will be 91+56 = <<91+56=147>>147 years.
#### 147

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 15, not 51. It appears two adjacent digits were swapped.
